intro: Justicia sebastianopolitanae, commonly known as the Sebastianopolis justicia, is a perennial shrub native to South America. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom in summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
